text:
Created attachment 35529
Error in UI

Environment: Apache 2.2,Apache Tomcat 8, JRE 1.8
Error: Randomly facing issues while accessing application which is configured in apache load balancer, facing 503 error with following error in mode_JK error file.

Description:

*[Tue Nov 07 08:46:06.139 2017] [7632:5600] [info] ajp_process_callback::jk_ajp_common.c (1945): Writing to client aborted or client network problems
[Tue Nov 07 08:46:06.139 2017] [7632:5600] [info] ajp_service::jk_ajp_common.c (2607): (jvm2) sending request to tomcat failed (unrecoverable), because of client write error (attempt=1)
[Tue Nov 07 08:46:06.139 2017] [7632:5600] [info] service::jk_lb_worker.c (1400): service failed, worker jvm2 is in local error state
[Tue Nov 07 08:46:06.139 2017] [7632:5600] [info] service::jk_lb_worker.c (1419): unrecoverable error 200, request failed. Client failed in the middle of request, we can't recover to another instance.
[Tue Nov 07 08:46:06.139 2017] [7632:5600] [info] jk_handler::mod_jk.c (2671): Aborting connection for worker=loadbalancer

Work around: The issue gets resolved after restarting Apache2.2 service.
Expectation: Need permanent solution for this issue as its a blocker for us.
creator: Devidutta.panda@ncr.com
toscano.luca@gmail.com
text:
Hi! 

Apache 2.2 is not supported anymore (EOL) so please update to 2.4 and verify if the issue persists.

Thanks!

Luca

Hi Luca,

Thanks for quick response. 

The version we are using is Apache 2.2.25, which has life support till 31st DEC 2017.

Please let us know any solution for this version.

Regards,
Devidutta
creator: Devidutta.panda@ncr.com

text: I see no software error, here. The log file says that the network write failed and mod_jk couldn't complete its work. There is nothing to be done, here, unless you can show that mod_jk should NOT be failing network writes for some reason.
creator: chris@christopherschultz.net
Devidutta.panda@ncr.com
text:
Created attachment 35530
Detailed Logs

Please find the detailed logs

creator: chris@christopherschultz.net
text:
(In reply to Devidutta Panda from comment #4)
> Created attachment 35530 [details]
> Detailed Logs
> 
> [Tue Nov 07 08:41:27.910 2017] [20408:5952] [info] jk_open_socket::jk_connect.c (626): connect to 172.17.8.12:8009 failed (errno=60)
> [Tue Nov 07 08:41:27.910 2017] [20408:5952] [info] ajp_connect_to_endpoint::jk_ajp_common.c (1008): Failed opening socket to (172.17.8.12:8009) (errno=60)
> [Tue Nov 07 08:41:27.910 2017] [20408:5952] [error] ajp_send_request::jk_ajp_common.c (1630): (jvm2) connecting to backend failed. Tomcat is probably not started or is listening on the wrong port (errno=60)
> [Tue Nov 07 08:41:27.910 2017] [20408:5952] [info] ajp_service::jk_ajp_common.c (2607): (jvm2) sending request to tomcat failed (recoverable), because of error during request sending (attempt=1)

What OS is this?

errno=60 on Linux is "device is not a stream"
errno=60 on MacOS is "Operation timed out"

I don't have any other machines handy right now to get others.

If errno=0 is "operation timed out" than there you have it: your network is unreachable for some reason. Software firewall, perhaps?

creator: chris@christopherschultz.net
text:
http://lmgtfy.com/?q=windows+errno+60

Let's move this discussion to the user's list, please, and not waste space in Bugzilla.
